div.h4: Important information about the Choctaw Nation of Oklahoma's COVID-19 precautions. Details | Closures

li.a: Hina Hanta: Choctaw Nation Museums Website

a.title: link to event registration for Healthy Aging

div.p: The Federal Communication Commission has requested broadband and wireless companies across the country to sign a âKeep Americans Connected Pledgeâ to ensure families have communication services during the Coronavirus Pandemic. To date, 550 companies have agreed to the following three conditions over the next 60 days:
In accordance with residential and small business customers, companies will:

ul.li: Not terminate service for inability to pay bill due to disruption caused by the pandemic;
Waive late fees due to economic hardships related to the pandemic;
Open Wi-Fi hotspots to any American who needs them.

div.p:
Choctaw Nation Territory
In response to COVID-19, the following Internet providers are offering special services to families and households with students throughout the 10Â½ counties.

ul.li: Qualified schools activating new lines on qualified data-only plans for school-issued tablets, 4G LTE-enabled laptops and hotspot devices will get the wireless data service at no cost for 60 days.

AccessMyLANTM for the qualified lines available at no cost for 60 days. This service allows school administrators to manage internet sites students can access to help protect from unsafe content and block malicious content, malware and hacking attempts.

Free access and unlimited usage of Caribu, a video-calling application that allows family members to read, draw, and play games with one another while in distant locations. The Caribu application, which integrates children's books, coloring activities, and games will be available to families across the country and around the world, free of cost, for the next two months.
Free, unlimited data for all residential internet wireline and fixed wireless internet customers.
Continue to offer internet access for qualifying limited income households at $10 month
Expanded eligibility to access from AT&T to households participating in the National School Lunch Program and Head Start.
New customers in education can connect and collaborate with ATT Office@Hand at no cost.

ATT created the Distance Learning and Family Connections Fund to give parents, students and teachers tools they need for at-home learning. For more information: https://about.att.com/story/2020/distance_learning_family_connections.html
Not terminate service for inability to pay bill due to disruption caused by the pandemic.
Waive late fees due to economic hardships related to the pandemic.
Open Wi-Fi hotspots to any American who needs them.
Not terminate service for inability to pay bill due to disruption caused by the pandemic.
Waive late fees due to economic hardships related to the pandemic.
Open Wi-Fi hotspots to any American who needs them.
Upgrading internet speeds.
Expanding Connect2complete services to ensure digital equality.
Offering a $19.99-month starter internet package, and eliminating data usage overages
Not terminate service for inability to pay bill due to disruption caused by the pandemic.
Waive late fees due to economic hardships related to the pandemic.
Open Wi-Fi hotspots to any American who needs them.
No information available
Not terminate service for inability to pay bill due to disruption caused by the pandemic.
Waive late fees due to economic hardships related to the pandemic.
Open Wi-Fi hotspots to any American who needs them.
Offering 75% off installation until further notice.
Setting up community WI-FI hot spots to offer free internet between 8 a.m.-9 p.m.
Increased speed received if monthly service plan is exceeded.
Optimized network traffic to prioritize education collaboration software.
Not terminate service for inability to pay bill due to disruption caused by the pandemic.
Not terminate service for inability to pay bill due to disruption caused by the pandemic.
Waive late fees due to economic hardships related to the pandemic.
Offer flexible payment plans.
Not terminate service for inability to pay bill due to disruption caused by the pandemic.
Waive late fees due to economic hardships related to the pandemic.
Open Wi-Fi hotspots to any American who needs them.
Waive late fees due to economic hardships related to the pandemic.
Offering flexible payment options.
Not terminate service for inability to pay bill due to disruption caused by the pandemic.
Waive late fees due to economic hardships related to the pandemic.
Open Wi-Fi hotspots to any American who needs them.
Offer a variety of internet service plans for new and existing customers with no data caps and no overage charges.
Discounts also are available for low-income customers through the Lifeline Assistance Program.
Until further notice offering 75% of installation.

div.p:
Yakoke (thank you) for visiting ChoctawNation.com. Need assistance? We are here to help!
You may contact us by completing the form provided, calling 1-800-522-6170 or by email
help@choctawnation.com

Mailing Address:
PO Box 1210, Durant, OK 74702-1210
(800) 522-6170

Physical Address:
1802 Chukka Hina
Durant,Â OKÂ 74701
